pullRequest.title: Feature/oc 572 handle mqtt get data messages

commit.message: OC-572 ~ Fixes incorrect device exists exception
OC-572 ~ Adds mockito and assertj dependencies

nodes.bodyText: Any reason to hard-code the message type instead of using response.getMessageType()?

Would it be OK or intended to sometimes have another message type than the one in response?
If not, what is the point of having a separate parameter with a hard-coded message type?
No modifier on the class? I think we commonly use public access.
This setup appears not to be necessary, since the only thing used from the ObjectMessage is the ResponseMessage from its object.
It looks like a simpler solution is to leave out all argument captor related stuff and just check with verify(this.adHocManagementService, times(1)).handleGetDataResponse(responseMessage);.

What should happen if the object contains something that cannot be cast to ResponseMessage?
Is it OK to have the exception being thrown and handled elsewhere, or should it be treated more like the way the JMSException is handled. It would certainly be an unrecoverable error, like in the message where the JMSException is handled.
What if the object in the ObjectMessage is null?
It might be good to deal with this explicitly, by either handling it as unrecoverable error or just returning the empty Optional using Optional.ofNullable.

In PeakShavingProducerConfig I noticed the topic was kept apart from the producer properties.
I was thinking that probably means that either it is not logical to have the topic as a separate constructor argument, or (more likely) that the topic is not an exclusive producer or consumer property, and it would be nicer to remove producer from the property name.

The way the DomainResponseMessageProcessor is handling things looks like that for now it does what it needs to do, but this way of special casing to determine what to do with a message could get quite messy as the number of messages grows.
In other parts of the code there is a message processor per message type giving a way to deal with one form of selection how to process messages that allows adding types without modifying the selection how to handle a specific one.
Perhaps the MeasurementReport is also for GET_DATA, in which case the method described before is not sophisticated enough. This may need some attention, in order to get a way of dealing with message types versus producer choice without using an ever growing block of code trying to figure out how to handle the input.
If an easy cleaner way is somehow simple to reach, you could consider it now. If this somewhat more complicated, we may need to prepare for some deeper thoughts when the time comes that more types of messages need to be dealt with.

Good catch.
Did you look at the other issues this class has as well?
I see a couple of TODOs, of which I wonder if they are still applicable, or could just be removed.
If you think it's a simple judgment call that they no longer apply (I'm not entirely sure) it might be nice to delete them and be done with them.
The reason I'm not sure is that I don't know if the AVRO MeterReading is the AVRO message format that was unknown when the TODOs were written, or that it is a temporary substitute awaiting a better type.
